sentence: IBM didn't release financial details of the acquisition.
It said that it acquired Optevia to meet the growing demand for Customer Relationship Management (CRM) SaaS solutions in the public sector.
It also said that it will let Optevia expand its solutions to a worldwide scale.
IBM also noted that Optevia will increase its current capabilities and help establish it "as a premier SaaS and digital consultant and accelerate leadership in CRM solutions."
Experts are estimating that CRM will grow to become a $23 billion opportunity.
It expects cloud-based CRM to make up more than half of that total.
Optevia users include "ministries, councils, regulators, licensing and grant management organizations, transport authorities and social housing organizations."
